# 1. Company Overview (UHS) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Universal Health Services, Inc. (UHS) is one of the nation's largest and most respected providers of hospital and healthcare services with approximately 99,300 employees dedicated to improving people's lives and transforming the delivery of healthcare. Universal Health Services, Inc. (UHS) is an American Fortune 500 company that provides hospital and healthcare services, based in King of Prussia, Pennsylvania. 

The company owns and operates acute care hospitals, outpatient facilities, and behavioral health care facilities. UHS services include general and specialty surgery, internal medicine, obstetrics, emergency room care, radiology, oncology, diagnostic care, coronary care, pediatric services, pharmacy services, and behavioral health services. UHS operates through its subsidiaries more than 400 acute care hospitals, behavioral health facilities, emergency departments and ambulatory centers. UHS operates 28 inpatient acute care hospitals, 331 inpatient behavioral health facilities, nearly 60 outpatient facilities and other facilities, an insurance offering, a physician network and various related services located in 39 U.S. states, Washington, D.C., Puerto Rico and the United Kingdom.

The company was founded by Alan B. Miller, who currently serves as the company's Executive Chairman, founded Universal Health Services, Inc. in 1979. Since its founding, UHS has grown strategically through acquisitions and organic expansion to become a major player in the healthcare industry.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

**Behavioral Health Care Services:**

**Additional Services:**

## 5. Growth Strategy

Our strategy includes building or acquiring high quality hospitals in rapidly growing markets, investing in the people and equipment needed to allow each facility to thrive, and becoming the leading healthcare provider in each community we serve. 

Key strategic focus areas include:

- Strategic acquisitions, partnerships, and investments in new facilities in high-growth areas are key to strengthening market position
- UHS plans to expand its behavioral health offerings next year to drive revenue growth, with a specific focus on outpatient services

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

- Private insurance and managed care organizations
- 5% of their acute admissions come from exchange-covered patients
- During 2024, through its network of subsidiaries, UHS cared for nearly 3.7 million patients

The company's diversified revenue streams (56% acute care, 44% behavioral health) and strategic acquisitions provide competitive advantages. Key strengths include a robust growth strategy focusing on high-growth markets, significant investments in new facilities, and a comprehensive service portfolio. Notable developments include expanding behavioral health offerings, opening new hospitals, and achieving cost savings through Accountable Care Organizations.

The AI investment rating is 7.2/10, with an estimated fair value of $265-$285 per share, suggesting approximately 20-30% upside potential driven by strong financial performance and market expansion opportunities.
